intro: Columbia scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Columbia scabra is often used in landscaping for its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
